title: Quiz 8: Evaluation & Assessment
description: Assess your mastery of evaluation principles, types of assessment, and tools for measuring student performance.

questions.question: Match the term with its definition:

pairs.right: Determining the degree of learning/objective achievement
Placing a value on performance to make a decision

questions.explanation: Assessment finds out; Evaluation values/decides; Measurement counts.

questions.question: Which type of evaluation is continuous, diagnostic, and provides feedback during the learning process?
questions.explanation: Formative evaluation 'forms' the learning through ongoing feedback.

questions.question: What are the advantages of OSCE (Objective Structured Clinical Examination)?

options.text: Separates assessment of process and product
It is very quick to organize

questions.explanation: OSCE is objective and comprehensive but is time-consuming to organize (disadvantage).

questions.question: In a professional course, excellence in theory marks can compensate for failure in practical skills.
questions.explanation: Practical competence is mandatory. Failure in practicals equals failure in the exam.
questions.hint: Can you operate just by reading a book?

questions.question: A tool that measures what it is intended to measure is said to have ___BLANK___.
Which tool is best for assessing ATTITUDES?
questions.explanation: Semantic differential scales measure attitudes using opposite adjectives.

questions.question: Name the scoring method where marks are awarded for specific points or facts present in the answer.
questions.explanation: Analytical scoring looks for specific details. Impression scoring looks at the whole.

questions.question: Order the steps for developing an assessment tool:
In an MCQ, the incorrect alternatives are called:
questions.explanation: Distracters draw attention away from the correct answer (Key).

questions.question: Summative evaluation is primarily used to diagnose learning difficulties during the course.
questions.explanation: Summative is for final grading. Formative is for diagnosis during the course.
questions.hint: Summative = Summing up at the end.
